sentences.en: A good man should disdain flatterers.
A great man should disdain flatterers.
sentences.cn: 伟大的人物应鄙视献媚者.

sentences.en: Allende showed his disdain for the Congressional action.
sentences.cn: 阿连德根本不把国会的决议放在眼里.

sentences.en: Behind closed doors he showed disdain for just about everybody.
sentences.cn: 他私下却几乎对每个人都表示藐视.

sentences.en: Childcare was seen as women’s work, and men disdained it.
sentences.cn: 照看儿童被视为女人做的工作，男人对此很不屑。

sentences.en: I would certainly disdain to live in such tiny flats.
sentences.cn: 我当然不愿意住在这样小的单元房里.

sentences.en: It is wrong to disdain a man merely becuse he is poor.
sentences.cn: 只因人穷就轻视他是不对的.

sentences.en: Janet looked at him with disdain.
Second Daughter - in - law and Third Daughter - in - law exchanged secret looks of disdain.
sentences.cn: 二奶奶和三奶奶偷偷做个鄙薄的眼色.

sentences.en: She curled her lips in disdain.
There was disdain in his smile.
sentences.cn: 他的微笑中含有轻蔑的意味.

trans.tran_en: If you feel disdain for someone or something, you dislike them because you think that they are inferior or unimportant
to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough
a complete lack of respect that you show for someone or something because you think they are not important or good enough

trans.tran_cn: 鄙视，不屑于做，不愿意做

trans.tran_en: a complete lack of respect that you show for someone or something because you think they are not important or good enough
